input_text:
Job Title: Senior Electrical Estimator

Location: Bakersfield, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Design, Management, Project Management

Description:
Mission: The Senior Electrical Estimator leads the Bid Team on projects with complete construction documents (plans and specifications) while working effectively with clients and developing future estimating leaders of A-C Electric Company. Key Responsibilities:Reviews and understands thoroughly the plans and specifications for each Bid Project assigned.Works through others on Bid Team to complete bid process from start to finish.Sets up the estimating plan: Determine the Take-Off structure to account for Bid Items and potential tracking (if applicable). Includes Bid Form, Labor, Kitting (as applicable), etc.Collaborates with CS Team to identify opportunities for prefab.Interfaces with Chief Estimators from GC.Develops junior estimators into future leaders.
Additional Job Duties:Reads plans and specs and completes Nickel Tour Document.Review Bid documents and determine BID strategies.Communicate w/customer to learn deadlines, list of competitors, etc.Works directly with Division Manager on bids, consistent messaging to customers, vendors, suppliers, manufacturers and subcontractors.Itemize and quantify all incidentals necessary in preparing the bid packages including: sub-contract work, equipment rental, tools and supplies.Manages take off process, delegates to team as appropriatePrepares RFIsPerforms budget pricing from conceptual design with alternatives. Determine and price value-engineered alternatives to plans and specs.Determines Project Estimated Value for projects and identifies ways to achieve at a profit. (Here are the opportunities in this project.)Selects quotes to use from Sub Contractors and Vendors. Develop detail scope and BOM for vendor and subcontractor packages.Develops budgets.Responsible for Scope Letter: Provides content for and in some cases create scope letterDevelops content and inputs into Bid form (Prime Bid)Final review of EBS for accuracy and completenessReviews Estimate Turnover Packages prior to being sent to DivisionsPrior to the issuing of the formal bid package, provide to the Chief Estimator a detailed review of scope, technical requirements and pricing for the estimated bid package.Ensures all Bid files are complete for bid close outSubmits final bid to client, works with them on questions.Project interviews and presentationsAfter successful bid (win), meet with project team to explain estimate, scope, quotes for successful transitionImplements measures to increase efficiency
Requirements:Electrical Design Experience7+ years Electrical Estimating ExperienceMcCormick or other Estimating Software ExperiencePublic and Private ExperienceCommercial and Industrial ExperienceStrong Communication and Collaboration SkillsHigh School Diploma or GEDExcel and Word
Preferred:2+ Years Estimating Supervision ExperienceCompleted Electrical Apprenticeship ProgramS. Electrical Engineering5+ years Electrical Field ExperienceAdditional Experience: Utility-Scale Solar, Commercial Solar, Traffic Signal/ITS.Contract management acumenAbility to plan, organize, and control all established bid process
Pay Range: Salary $90,000-$195,000 Salary. Pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements dependent on the position offered.
*A-C Electric Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer; women, veterans, and minorities are encouraged to apply.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: Senior Electrical Estimator
output_json.summary: The Senior Electrical Estimator leads the Bid Team on projects with complete construction documents.
required_skills: McCormick or other Estimating Software Experience
optional_skills: Ability to plan, organize, and control all established bid process
job_responsibilities: Reviews and understands thoroughly the plans and specifications for each Bid Project assigned.
Works through others on Bid Team to complete bid process from start to finish.
Sets up the estimating plan: Determine the Take-Off structure to account for Bid Items and potential tracking (if applicable).
Collaborates with CS Team to identify opportunities for prefab.
Interfaces with Chief Estimators from GC.
Develops junior estimators into future leaders.
Reads plans and specs and completes Nickel Tour Document.
Review Bid documents and determine BID strategies.
Communicate w/customer to learn deadlines, list of competitors, etc.
Works directly with Division Manager on bids, consistent messaging to customers, vendors, suppliers, manufacturers and subcontractors.
Itemize and quantify all incidentals necessary in preparing the bid packages including: sub-contract work, equipment rental, tools and supplies.
Manages take off process, delegates to team as appropriate
Prepares RFIs
Performs budget pricing from conceptual design with alternatives.
Determines Project Estimated Value for projects and identifies ways to achieve at a profit.
Selects quotes to use from Sub Contractors and Vendors.
Develops budgets.
Responsible for Scope Letter: Provides content for and in some cases create scope letter.
Develops content and inputs into Bid form (Prime Bid).
Final review of EBS for accuracy and completeness.
Reviews Estimate Turnover Packages prior to being sent to Divisions.
Prior to the issuing of the formal bid package, provide to the Chief Estimator a detailed review of scope, technical requirements and pricing for the estimated bid package.
Ensures all Bid files are complete for bid close out.
Submits final bid to client, works with them on questions.
Project interviews and presentations.
After successful bid (win), meet with project team to explain estimate, scope, quotes for successful transition.
Implements measures to increase efficiency.
benefits: Pay range may vary depending on multiple individualized factors
Total compensation package may include other elements dependent on the position offered
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: A-C Electric Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer; women, veterans, and minorities are encouraged to apply.
